name: Rarebird
headline: Elevating mental health to be a part of your daily coffee ritual.
description: We are making coffee for caffeine sensitive people. We do this by producing the world's first caffeine replacement, paraxanthine. It's better than caffeine at waking you up and causes fewer side effects, like anxiety and jitteriness.

founders.name: Jeffrey Dietrich, Founder
founders.description: Jeffrey Dietrich received his Ph.D. in BioEngineering from UC-Berkeley working in Jay Keasling’s lab to develop new biomanufacturing technologies. Jeffrey then co-founded and was CTO at Lygos (YC W16), which raised over $40MM in equity financing and $10MM in Federal awards to commercialize industrial biochemicals. He has also served on advisory boards for Department of Energy- and National Science Foundation-backed institutions and is an inventor on 17 patents or patent applications.

# Coffee, without the negative consequences
Freshly roasted coffee with Px, a caffeine replacement that energizes without the jitters and won't disrupt your sleep.
[ Try Px Ground Coffee Arrow ](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</products/award-winning-px-paraxanthine-coffee>) [ Try Px Coffee Pods Arrow ](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</products/px-coffee-pods-box>)
## As featured in
  * ![Perfect Daily Grind](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/featured-in-perfect-daily-grind.png?v=128884770640204943101708028908)
  * ![AGFunder News](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/featured-in-ag-funder-news.png?v=73570776908907768481708028906)
  * ![Forbes](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/featured-in-forbes.png?v=98424195017141908121708028907)
  * ![Food & Beverage Insider](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/featured-in-food-beverage-insider.png?v=26009817153955227411708028907)
  * ![Gear Patrol](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/featured-in-gear-patrol.png?v=28253071178617438881708028908)


## The buzz you need, without the BS.
Instead of caffeine, our coffee contains Px, a caffeine derivative your body naturally makes after you consume caffeine.
Just like caffeine, Px wakes you up and reduces fatigue. But unlike caffeine, Px won’t leave you feeling jittery, wired, or over-caffeinated. Px is also cleared from your body faster than caffeine, so you can drink Px coffee without it affecting your sleep at night.
![wellness](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/homepage-comparison.jpg?v=153350190322083727811724809917)
## Brewed just like Regular Coffee
### The same steps you know
#### 1
#### Filter
#### 2
#### Brew
#### 3
#### Enjoy
![Best New Product Award, 2023 Specialty Coffee Assocation Expo ](http://rarebird.coffee/cdn/shop/t/2/assets/award-vibrant-square.jpg?v=7535044306434507251723147416)
## Expert-Approved
Rarebird Px Coffee was voted “Best New Product” at the 2023 Specialty Coffee Association Expo. Experts were drawn to Px Coffee’s functionality — as well as its flavor.
[ Learn more about our coffee Arrow ](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</pages/about-our-coffee>)
## Same Ritual, Better Results
Brew It Your Way: Ground or Pods
[ Ground Px Coffee  Arrow Smooth energy, however you brew.
  * Versatile
  * Bold
  * 12oz / 2lb

](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</products/award-winning-px-paraxanthine-coffee>) [ Px Coffee Pods  Arrow Full flavor, zero hassle.
  * Quick
  * Convenient
  * Single-Serve

](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</products/px-coffee-pods-box>)
About Px
## Better ingredients create better outcomes
01.
Safe
## Safe
• Backed by years of peer-reviewed scientific and clinical evidence• Affirmed as a Generally Recognized as Safe (GRAS) ingredient
02.
Drop
## Pure
• Validated by independent, 3rd-party laboratories to meet stringent quality standards
03.
Circle with dot
## Effective
• Demonstrated in clinical research to have benefits
[ Learn more Arrow ](http://www.rarebird.coffee/</pages/about-px-paraxanthine>)
## FAQs
  * ###  What are the benefits of Px Coffee?  Plus Minus
Px Coffee improves your mood, focus, and sleep. It helps with focus and energy like caffeine, but without the jittery, wired feeling. Px breaks down in your body faster than caffeine, which lets you enjoy a cup in the afternoon or early evening without disrupting your sleep.
  * ###  How soon will I notice a difference with Px Coffee?  Plus Minus
Many customers notice a difference after just a few cups. We recommend switching to Px Coffee for at least five days to fully experience its benefits to mood, focus, and sleep.
  * ###  What exactly is Px?  Plus Minus
Here’s the science: Px is the primary metabolite of caffeine—your body converts about 80% of the caffeine you consume into Px. It doesn’t occur in plants like caffeine does, but it exists naturally in the human body.
We at Rarebird have developed unique technology with the help of the National Science Foundation to produce the first and only coffee that contains Px instead of caffeine.
  * ###  Will Px coffee taste different than traditional coffee?  Plus Minus
No – Px Coffee looks, smells, and tastes just like traditional coffee, and is brewed just like traditional coffee. The only difference is that it contains Px instead of caffeine. It’s just two simple ingredients: Arabica coffee (with the caffeine removed) and Px!
We work with sustainably focused coffee importers to ensure the highest quality standards, ultimately providing you a cup that tastes as good as it makes you feel.
  * ###  How is Px Coffee made?  Plus Minus
We start with a specialty-grade Colombian Arabica coffee, which is decaffeinated at the source using the Sugarcane process. This method is safe, environmentally friendly, and preserves the flavor exceptionally well. The coffee is then shipped to the US, where it is tested for mycotoxins upon arrival.
Px infusion and roasting occurs at our facility in California just before it's freshly shipped out to you.
  * ###  What is the best way to brew Px Coffee?  Plus Minus
We grind Px coffee to a medium grind for the most universal utilization. Whether you use a drip brewer, a pour-over, or a French press, this grind should be the perfect fit!
  * ###  Do you offer Px Coffee in a whole bean option?  Plus Minus
Unfortunately, we do not currently offer whole bean coffee at this time, but we hope to provide this option in the near future. For now, we only offer ground coffee.
To address common concerns with ground coffee, we take several important steps:
    1. We only procure specialty-grade coffee that has been grown and harvested sustainably.
    2. We roast and fulfill orders as they are received to ensure our customers always drink fresh coffee with minimal oxidation exposure.
    3. We grind our coffee to a medium grind size, offering maximum flexibility for brewing, whether you prefer a pour-over, auto-drip, or French press.
  * ###  Can I order Px Coffee in bulk for my office?  Plus Minus
Yes — Rarebird’s benefits make it the perfect brew for your office. You can learn more about office discounts and [place your order here](http://www.rarebird.coffee/<https:/rarebird.coffee/pages/wholesale-px-coffee>).
  * ###  What’s the best way to get in touch with Rarebird regarding my order or product feedback?  Plus Minus
Have a question about your order or want to share your experience? We’d love to hear from you! Email us at contact@rarebird.coffee, and we’ll get back to you as soon as possible.
  * ###  Can I take these products while pregnant or nursing?  Plus Minus
For your safety, we recommend consulting your healthcare professional before consuming any Rarebird coffees if you are pregnant or nursing.

generated_description:
**Rarebird: Turning Coffee on Its Head**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from the vibrant San Leandro, California, Rarebird is upending the coffee game. Imagine waking up to a cup of coffee that doesn’t make you jittery, anxious, or disrupt your sleep. That’s the mission here: to elevate mental health and coffee culture hand-in-hand. With a nod to wellness enthusiasts, they're introducing Px coffee—a revolutionary caffeine replacement that claims to be better than caffeine itself.

Rarebird's story began with a simple realization: caffeine, while effective in boosting alertness, often comes with some undesired baggage. Enter paraxanthine (Px), the primary metabolite of caffeine that your body naturally produces. Rarebird has harnessed this concept to create a unique product that retains coffee's comforting ritual while cutting out the jitters.

With an expert-supported approach, they have meticulously developed this product, backed by the National Science Foundation. Their Px coffee is made from Colombian Arabica beans processed in a way that preserves flavors while being kinder to your body.

The team is small but mighty, consisting of just five dedicated employees. As part of Y Combinator's S20 batch, they've gained traction and visibility, drawing interest from various media like Forbes and Perfect Daily Grind. Their goal? To make Px coffee an integral part of your daily routine—right alongside your morning ritual.

Currently, Rarebird offers a range of options, including ground coffee and single-serve pods. The beauty of Px is that it promises to energize without the negative consequences typically associated with traditional caffeine. Brewed just like any regular coffee, it caters to both convenience lovers and those who enjoy a good pour-over.

The company is steadily building a brand that aligns itself with a growing preference for wellness-focused products. If you think about it, a cup of Rarebird coffee might just be the antidote for those who want their caffeine fix without the complications. So why not try it? You might be surprised to find a little buzz without the BS.

For more information, visit [rarebird.coffee](http://www.rarebird.coffee).
